description: pix (“pictures”), + el(ement); often taken to be a blend of “picture” and “element”. The ⟨x⟩ stems from the abbreviation pics being sometimes also written as pix, which has been in use since the 1880s. First attested in 1965.

entries.meaning: One of the tiny dots that make up the representation of an image in a computer's memory.
One of the squares that make up a pixel art work or a zoomed in image in a computer.

verbs.description: pixel (third-person singular simple present pixels, present participle pixeling or pixelling, simple past and past participle pixeled or pixelled)

entries.meaning: To create computer graphics by editing individual pixels.
examples: Whether he's pixeling for cellphones or PCs, here is one artist who has a unique and imaginative vision.
